text: Toles realized the man responsible for Floyd’s death was the same police officer who barged into his home and beat him up in the bathroom before shooting him in the stomach 12 years earlier while responding to a domestic violence call  https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH

name: thedailybeast
text: “When I saw that he breached the front door, I ran in the bathroom,” Toles told The Daily Beast. “Then [Chauvin] starts kicking in that door. I was in the bathroom with a cigarette and no lighter.” https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH

name: thedailybeast
text: He continued to describe the horrifying incident: “I didn’t know what to think when he started hitting me. I swear he was hitting me with the gun.” https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH

name: thedailybeast
text:
Toles believes that Floyd’s horrific death could have been prevented if Chauvin was properly punished for his violent arrest in May 2008.

“If he was reprimanded when he shot me, George Floyd would still be alive,” Toles said.
https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH

name: thedailybeast
text:
He added that while he never filed a complaint in 2008, he is now looking to sue the Minneapolis Police Department for the violent incident. 

“We’ve all reached our tipping point. Water boils at 212 degrees,” he said. “We’re at 600.” https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH

name: thedailybeast
text:
“I knew he would do something again,” Toles added. “I wish we had smartphones back then.”

Read the full story from @pbmelendez here:  https://t.co/EP2wsVBvQH
